title: 114_s1799
content: The "Community Bank Sensible Regulation Act of 2015" allows the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation to have exemptive authority. The Federal Deposit Insurance Act is amended to grant the Corporation the authority to exempt depository institutions with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules. The Corporation may impose conditions on any exemptions granted and must consider specific factors when issuing an exemption. The Federal Deposit Insurance Act allows the Corporation to exempt depository institutions with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules. The exemption is subject to conditions and must consider factors like burden, safety, soundness, and public interest. The asset threshold is indexed annually based on changes in total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions. SEC. 3. EXEMPTIVE AUTHORITY FOR THE OFFICE OF THE COMPTROLLER OF THE CURRENCY. The amendment grants the Comptroller of the Currency the authority to exempt national banks with less than $10 billion in total assets from certain provisions and rules under the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. The Comptroller may impose conditions on exemptions granted to national banks with less than $10 billion in total assets. Factors considered include burden/cost, safety/soundness promotion, and public interest alignment. The asset threshold for insured depository institutions will be annually increased based on the total aggregate assets, rounded to the nearest $10,000,000. The Comptroller of the Currency has exemptive authority for savings associations, defined as insured depository institutions under the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. The Comptroller of the Currency may exempt savings associations with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules, with the ability to impose conditions on the exemption granted. Factors considered include the extent to which certain criteria are met. The Comptroller of the Currency may exempt savings associations with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules based on criteria such as burden, safety, soundness, and public interest. The asset threshold will be annually adjusted based on the change in total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions. Insured depository institutions are required to report their total assets annually, with an asset threshold of $10,000,000,000 for savings associations. The threshold is adjusted based on changes in total aggregate assets. SEC. 4. EXEMPTIVE AUTHORITY FOR THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE SYSTEM. Exemptive Authority for State Member Banks: The Federal Reserve Act is amended to allow the Board to exempt State member banks with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions and rules. The Board has the authority to impose conditions on exemptions granted to State member banks with assets under $10,000,000,000. Factors considered include burden/cost, safety/soundness, and public interest. The asset threshold will be annually indexed for changes in total assets. The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 is amended to include exemptive authority for bank holding companies, with the percentage change in total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions being a key factor. The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 is amended to include exemptive authority for bank holding companies. The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 is amended to include exemptive authority for bank holding companies with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets. The Board may grant exemptions from certain provisions or rules if they impose unnecessary burdens or costs. Conditions may be imposed on any exemptions granted. The Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 is amended to provide exemptive authority for bank holding companies with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets. The Board can grant exemptions from provisions or rules that create undue burden or cost, are unnecessary for safety and soundness, and are in the public interest. Asset thresholds will be indexed annually based on changes in total aggregate assets of insured depository institutions. Savings and Loan Holding Companies and Mutual Holding Companies are also granted exemptive authority under the Home Owners' Loan Act. The Board may exempt savings and loan holding companies or mutual holding companies with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets from certain provisions or rules under the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956. The Board has the authority to impose conditions on exemptions granted to savings and loan holding companies or mutual holding companies with less than $10,000,000,000 in total assets under the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956. Factors considered include burden/cost, safety/soundness, and public interest. The authority granted under the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 to impose conditions on exemptions for savings and loan holding companies does not apply to those described in subsection (c)(9)(C). The asset threshold mentioned in the Act will be annually increased based on the percentage change in total assets of insured depository institutions.
